definition: to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: Can Bear hardships and hard work, healthly and strong, could adapt aloft operation outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 吃苦耐劳，身体健硕，适应户外高空操作设备。

sentences.english: Good communication, work hard and endure hardships, long-term work at.
sentences.chinese: 善于沟通，吃苦耐劳，能长期在项目现场工作。
煤矿工人都是能吃苦耐劳的。

sentences.english: "We learned to endure hardship, " she says.
Hiring constrcution people, labour working, need to be harding working, immigrant or citizen preferred.
sentences.chinese: 招聘装修杂工，要能够吃苦耐劳，移民或者公民。

sentences.english: Conclusions Provoking energetically the traditional cultural spirit of Hakkas should be done.
sentences.chinese: 结论应积极发扬客家传统文化和吃苦耐劳的精神。

sentences.english: Most of the soldiers were hardy young men.
sentences.chinese: 大部分士兵都是吃苦耐劳的年轻小伙。

sentences.english: Diligent, strong sense of responsibility, knowledge-craving as well as team-work spirited .
sentences.chinese: 工作努力，责任心强，吃苦耐劳，上进，组织观念强。

sentences.english: But she was tough enough to face it.
sentences.chinese: 但她足够吃苦耐劳来面对挑战。

definition: to bear hardships and work hard (idiom); assiduous and long-suffering/hard-working and capable of overcoming adversity
hardworking and thrifty in running one's household
firm and indomitable (idiom); tenacious and unyielding
